definition: fingerboard (of a guitar or violin etc)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Optimizing the height profile of the fingerboard is worth the effort for almost all instruments.
sentences.chinese: 优选指板的高度外形值得努力为几乎所有仪器。

sentences.english: In the generally customary construction of fingerboards the scale length is divided by way of calculation.
sentences.chinese: 在指板的一般习惯的建筑标度长度被划分通过演算。

sentences.english: The bridge is also made from maple, and the fingerboard and the pegs for the strings usually from ebony.
sentences.chinese: 琴码也由枫木制成，指板和弦钮由乌木制作。

sentences.english: I don't like studs. You have to make a very wide groove.
sentences.chinese: 我不太喜欢倒勾，因为你必须在指板上挖较宽的沟。

definition: tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
